Reviews.text: I'm actually somewhat disappointed that this headset connects to devices via USB. Personally, I would have preferred something that I can plug into my cell phone or home phone. Overall the headset is quite functional. I can't say it's the most comfortable, but for quick conversations, that won't last for hours, it's comfortable enough. The best feature is the Inline control panel, which, again, would have been great to use with other devices that do not have a USB. Sound quality was fine, it isn't bluetooth so there isn't that much you're risking as it is directly connected to your PC or Mac. Price wise it is a little more than I'd want to pay, but overall you're getting a pretty good headset.

Reviews.text:
I have found these to be best with Skype and for listening to books on tape. They are especially good at canceling out the ambient sound while talking to someone on Skype. My computer has a built in mic so I always think that it is sufficient but I know from listening to other people that the built in mic is not very good. I'd like to put a pair of these on everyone I talk to in the course of a day. The Plantronics are comfortable to wear and I have found them to be expandable enough even for my big head. ALL of the errors caused while wearing these headphones were mine.

PICNIC= Problem in Chair, Not In Computer

FIRST I tried to plug these into my ipod and if that had worked, my husband would have made none of the following Statements in this order:

1. You are the most inept person I have ever known.
2. I can't believe you just did that.
3. You're not a systems person. You are too impatient.
4. You know how to wreck a football game.
5. I wish to have a home in which I can experience tranquility.
6. Michigan has got no defense. Pathetic.

These headphones are USB, which I paid no attention to, none whatsoever. When they didn't have the right plug for my ipod, I put the ipod down and tried to plug them into my computer only to discover that my entire music library had been STOLEN. Then I was informed that my husband has been trying to get my computer away from me for SIX weeks so he could connect my itunes to his icloud. Some mumbled comments continued and then were followed by Statement 1.

So I finally hooked up to his iCloud and then found the Amy Winehouse album. But then the headphones transmitted NO SOUND whatsoever. No sound even when it was turned up ALL the way. So I went off to explore a whole new mystery. And I found the solution in my system preferences. It was called, aptly, SOUND. I selected the Plantronics as my device. It STILL didn't work.

And that was when I made my last mistake. I clicked on output and then changed it to Plantronics .Audio478 USB.

When Amy Winehouse started playing at my highest possible volume, I screamed and fell off the couch, head first, because my legs were over the back of the couch. That knocked the cat off my stomach. The cat jumped on the dog who got up and barked, which caused the cat in my husband's lap to run up his face and try to stick on his head.

Statements 2, 3, 4, and 5 followed this debacle.

They tried to get me to watch football and I said no, no, no.

Hoping not to hear football either, I looked for noise canceling capabilities but this was not to be. Otherwise I would not have heard Statement 6.
Reviews.title: Perfect for hearing voices

Reviews.text:
This review is about an unpleasant seller not the Plantronics headphones.

I bought my sister headphones from ANTOnline (Atlanta Network Technologies) and discovered that she already had a better set. My mistake -- and so it's only fair that I pay for postage. I knew this when I wrote to ask for an RMA with the option checked 'ordered by mistake' or similar phrase.

ANTOnline replied with an email well within the 48 hour window in which the seller should reply, so that was good. But their email was so in my face that I shrank back. Lots of bold face and capital letters, as if they were yelling at me and implying that I was pulling a fast one or maybe wanted to do this.

Yikes! I thought, get over it. e.g. "Under no circumstances will returns be accepted after 30 days" and "under no circumstances will we accept returns with imperfecto packaging" (OK paraphrasing on that one). The whole tone was just so unpleasant.

OK they are in business, but I WILL NOT BUY FROM THEM AGAIN (see what I mean - but imagine those words are in bold as well). Not when there are cool and nice people out there selling. Next time I buy something I'll look into who is selling first and what they are like about returns.

So I've decided to keep the headphones because I don't want the hassle of dealing with these guys further. By the way, I haven't actually checked to see if the headphones work as yet. If they do I can give them to someone or put them in my own case as a spare pair.
Reviews.title: Was this seller shouting at me?
